analytic.title: Single Pass PCA of Matrix Products

abstract.p: In this paper we present a new algorithm for computing a low rank approximation of the product A T B by taking only a single pass of the two matrices A and B. The straightforward way to do this is to (a) first sketch A and B individually, and then (b) find the top components using PCA on the sketch. Our algorithm in contrast retains additional summary information about A, B (e.g. row and column norms etc.) and uses this additional information to obtain an improved approximation from the sketches. Our main analytical result establishes a comparable spectral norm guarantee to existing two-pass methods; in addition we also provide results from an Apache Spark implementation 1 that shows better computational and statistical performance on real-world and synthetic evaluation datasets.
